intro: Gagea welwitschii, commonly known as the Namibian gagea, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
